name: Maine Intercultural Communication Consultants
description: Offers training for schools and businesses that promotes critical race theory-aligned ideas and advocates for setting equity standards. They provide single training sessions and longer programs on cultural differences and other DEI topics
services: Chinese-American-owned Diversity training in Maine consultation

name: Cross-Cultural Community Services
description: Dedicated to combating, advocating, and consulting on the experiences of people of color and immigrant and refugee communities
services: Chinese-American-owned Diversity training in Maine consultation

name: Beyond Racial Equity
description: Provides a framework to dismantle systemic racism and build racial equity in businesses. They enable organizations to drive their own ongoing equity and build it into their organizational culture
services: Chinese-American-owned Diversity training in Maine consultation

name: Mandy Levine Consulting, LLC
description: Facilitates DEI-related workshops and provides consulting services to help organizations embed DEI throughout their structure
services: Chinese-American-owned Diversity training in Maine consultation

name: Holloway Group LLC
description: Provides customized professional development training packages with real-world experience, using hands-on activities and engaging presentations
services: Chinese-American-owned Diversity training in Maine consultation

name: YWCA Central Maine
description: Offers workshops on Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Intersectionality (DEI&I) and provides organizational equity audits and consulting
services: Chinese-American-owned Diversity training in Maine consultation

name: IntWork
description: Partners with employers to build globally competent teams and provides staffing and consulting to hire and retain diverse talent, with a focus on BIPOC, immigrant, and bilingual individuals

name: MaineTransNet
description: Provides cultural competency and allyship training to support transgender, non-binary, and gender diverse populations, as well as technical support consultations
services: Chinese-American-owned Diversity training in Maine consultation

name: Racial Equity & Justice Firm (REJ)
description: Offers professional development programs on racial equity, diversity, and implicit bias, including organizational analysis and solution-based discussions. Co-facilitated by UMaine alumni David Patrick and Desiree Vargas

name: Inclusion Maine
description: Organizes the Inclusion Maine Conference and provides services on recruiting, consulting, and organizational assessments with the mission of improving workforce diversity and inclusion
